Question
========

Below is a portion of an ANOVA table belonging to a CRD ANOVA with 5 groups and 3 measurements per group.

  --------------- ---- ---- ---- --- --- Source of variation df SS MS F P Among groups 4 48 Within groups 10 15 Total 14 63 --------------- ---- ---- ---- --- ---

Suppose the F-value of this ANOVA table was equal to 3.0; then the following would apply for the corresponding P value to hold (Î±=5%):

Answerlist
----------

* P > 0.05: no significant differences between groups
* P > 0.05: significant differences between groups
* P < 0.05: no significant differences between groups
* P > 0.05: do have significant differences between groups.

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* P > 0.05: no significant differences between groups: Correct
* P > 0.05: do have significant differences between groups: Incorrect
* P < 0.05: no significant differences between groups: Incorrect
* P > 0.05: significant differences between groups: Incorrect
